name: Solace Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Agree with the other reviewers here. The hotel is brand new, clean, has huge rooms, and is much nicer than the other upscale options in town. If you're able to wait, they had very cheap last-minute deals when we were there -- about 1/2 off.
reviews.title: New and great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel provides superb accommodation at a very reasonable price. We arranged a taxi transfer from Puerto Montt airport and that was not expensive either. The Solace is a very new hotel and is in a lovely position overlooking the town of Puerto Varas with Volcan Osorno in the background, only a short walk down the hill to the centre and the lake. We had a huge room on the 5th floor. Everything was perfect: an enormous comfortable bed, spotless, crisp bedding, a large ensuite bathroom, sitting area and free wi-fi. The bar and restaurant provide very good food indeed. There is a good choice at breakfast and the evening meal we had during our 3 night stay was exceptional. It was so good, we asked whether the chef had time to speak to us and we congratulated him on his expertise. The staff are helpful and friendly. We enjoyed a wonderful stay and wished we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Magnficent views and great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our recent trip to Santiago and Easter Island, we stayed at The Hotel Solace for 3 nights and were very pleased. Beautiful, contemporary decor, great service with an excellent location. Great choice and value; cant imagine staying anywhere else in PV.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Solace is quite an expensive option, but we chose it because of good reports in Trip Advisor. It didn't live up to expectations. Our bedroom was modern and spacious (though without the lake view we requested, and it's a bit of a stretch to call it a junior suite) - but there were no drawers at all, and only very limited shelf space. There were not enough hangers and it took 3 phone calls to get some more. We phoned for an iron, but to our amazement were told that they were not able to provide one !! (The other hotels we stayed in during this trip happily provided irons) .The hotel seemed to be managerless during our stay, so there was no decision maker to whom we could complain. There was no hotel/TV guide provided, so we had to flick through about 100 channels, only to discover that there was not a single channel in English - not even CNN or BBC World ! On the plus side, the bathroom was fine and the bed was very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was a bit strange: fine if you like cheescakes or lemon meringue pie, but the hot food wasn't appealing - though to be fair the chef did happily rustle up some fresh scrambled eggs & mushrooms. The hotel has a computer room with free broadband, and is well located on a hill close to the town centre (we can recommend Restaurant La Marca close to the hotel on the way down to town). So, the Solace was a bit of a mixed bag, but, overall, not as good as we expected.
reviews.title: Pay in dollars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Solace Hotel provides the perfect combination of quiet location and close proximity to the action two blocks away. It is a brand new hidden gem filled with fine art, stunning crafts, spacious luxurious rooms, wonderful breakfast, safe guarded parking, elevator, helpful staff, lovely restaurant with varied menu, wifi, etc. We drove into Puerto Varas on a weekend and were shocked at the completely crowded streets, tons of street vendors, traffic, and noise. Within a few streets we found the Solace Hotel on a quiet back street that felt totally removed from the maddening crowd, yet at night we were able to walk into the melee within a few minutes....what a difference. Our room was gorgeous- beautiful furniture, trendy artistry, refrigerator, great bathroom, lovely king bed and fine linens, quiet, relaxing...perfect. I suspect that the price will go up when the hotel is further along but for now, it is a travel bargain and probably will always be a little lower priced than those along the beach. GO and enjoy!
reviews.title: Solace in the midst of crowds- a miracle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made the mistake of staying at Hotel Puelche our first night (based on the customer reviews on trip advisor). Our second time around in Puerto Varas we decided to check out Solace since we had passed it a number of times and it looked nice.
reviews.title: Great new hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at Solace for two nights on a visit to Puerto Varas. Warm, cozy decor with heavy use of wood in a very modern style. I would definitely tell anybody looking for an up-end hotel in Puerto Varas to stay here. Excellent value - it felt like a much more expensive hotel. Located on a hill 2 blocks from the main downtown area of Puerto Varas, it does not have the views offered by some other hotels closer to the water, but we had a very nice view of the cathedral from our spacious, warm, comfortable room. Arriving at the hotel after a long stressful day traveling was lie a breath of fresh air. Once we got to the room it was like we could once again relax in a comfortable environment. Hotel would best be used as a base for multiple excursions based out of Puerto Varas, all of which the extremely helpful hotel staff will be more than happy to arrange for you. Breakfast is usually included and consists of a buffet with cereal, good fruit, juice, breads, coffee, eggs, some kind of sausage and ham. Americans should find all their breakfast needs met. Good spaces throughout the hotel for sitting and relaxing, and high speed WiFi throughout. I would stay again in a heart beat.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel at a great price

reviews.text: This hotel is all one may want for a great time in Puerto Varas! New, clean, confortable, nice space in the bedroom, good cable TV, very good beds and matresses. I mean: it is really very good. Also, the staff is gentle and very well prepared to deal with foreing people.
reviews.title: Just go to Solace and enjoy Puerto Varas!

reviews.text: The only minus I found there goes to the restaurant service at breakfast time. Can't understant why they will never - never -- replace a napkin when they clean a table after the first use and left it ready for the next guest. This next one won't have a napkin... Have to ask for it -- every time, every morning. The delivery of coffee, tea and milk is also weak. The waitress serves these itens, they are not available on the buffett, and you have to look around for five minutes or more, until her eyes catches yours and she understands you want some coffee...

Absolutely wonderful hotel. Enjoyed the staff, the location, the comfort.
reviews.text: Staying at the Solace reminds you of Switzerland. The junior suites are large and clean, with views of the lake, the three volcanos. The staff is friendly and made us feel at home. There is a small car rental across the street if you need a car.

description: Solace Hotel has been built in a modern style according to the highest standards of efficiency and qualified service. It was thought to satisfy most travelers' needs, in an environment full of warm and comfort. Its building remarks natural elements, as wood, stone, looms, among others. Wide and comfortable rooms, fine decorated and equipped to provide functionality. Warm, comfort and privacy, to have a unique and unforgettable stay. All our rooms have a privileged view to the city, main, church, Llanquihue Lake and Osorno and Calbuco Volcanoes. 07 Suites Rooms and 79 junior Suites Rooms.
